update.description:
Port track drive vehicle support from Gazebo9, which was originally added in this pull request: [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2652/added-support-for-tracked-vehicles/](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2652/added-support-for-tracked-vehicles/) .

* Emulate tracks using overlapping wheels, which makes the code basically the same as that for DiffDrive.
* Need friction cone model for proper steering, which appears to not be in Dart.
* The Contact Surface Motion method requires friction cone model in order to work, so it is not implemented yet.
update.title: Add track drive vehicle system

content.raw: declining this because we modified the diff drive system instead
content.html: declining this because we modified the diff drive system instead

content.raw:

content.html:

content.raw: Just talked to Ian. Yea I will set out to add an example using DiffDrive as a tracked drive, and make a separate pull request!
content.html: Just talked to Ian. Yea I will set out to add an example using DiffDrive as a tracked drive, and make a separate pull request!

content.raw:
Yes, I had the same feeling of uneasiness when I first asked about whether we should add TrackDrive as a separate system.

Since I have already received some communication on that we are going to resolve the physics engine issue soon, \(although it is not set in stone yet\). I am thinking we could leave this pull request open for now, and have it merged together with the better model once that gets implemented?

As for tracked drive demo, I don’t know when do we need that out. But if we do not need that out really soon, I would similarly leave it until we got the actual tracked drive. Otherwise, we might end up with two ways to use tracked drive, or I will need to undo the work after that. It wouldn’t be too much trouble to adapt the diff drive, it is just the cycle of doing work and undoing work that concerns me.

These are just my opinions given the information I have currently. I am open to any other directions on how to proceed with this issue.
content.html:
Yes, I had the same feeling of uneasiness when I first asked about whether we should add TrackDrive as a separate system.

Since I have already received some communication on that we are going to resolve the physics engine issue soon, (although it is not set in stone yet). I am thinking we could leave this pull request open for now, and have it merged together with the better model once that gets implemented?

As for tracked drive demo, I don’t know when do we need that out. But if we do not need that out really soon, I would similarly leave it until we got the actual tracked drive. Otherwise, we might end up with two ways to use tracked drive, or I will need to undo the work after that. It wouldn’t be too much trouble to adapt the diff drive, it is just the cycle of doing work and undoing work that concerns me.

These are just my opinions given the information I have currently. I am open to any other directions on how to proceed with this issue.

content.raw:
Gotcha, that makes sense, I wasn't aware that we were planning to expand it.

Even so, the code is so similar right now that my preference would still be to add the missing parameter to the existing plugin instead of copying the code to a new plugin. This way we make sure that whenever a feature is added or a bug is fixed in diff drive, any tracked vehicles can also benefit. When we get to the point of implementing a more accurate model, then we can revisit this and add a new plugin if needed. Based on past experience, there's a high chance we don't revisit this for years and end up with 2 very similar plugins which have different bug fixes :grimacing:

Would it be too much trouble to add the parameter to diff drive and adapt the example to use that?
content.html:
Gotcha, that makes sense, I wasn't aware that we were planning to expand it.

Even so, the code is so similar right now that my preference would still be to add the missing parameter to the existing plugin instead of copying the code to a new plugin. This way we make sure that whenever a feature is added or a bug is fixed in diff drive, any tracked vehicles can also benefit. When we get to the point of implementing a more accurate model, then we can revisit this and add a new plugin if needed. Based on past experience, there's a high chance we don't revisit this for years and end up with 2 very similar plugins which have different bug fixes

Would it be too much trouble to add the parameter to diff drive and adapt the example to use that?

* Emulate tracks using overlapping wheels, which makes the code basically the same as that for DiffDrive.

update.title: Add track drive vehicle system

content.raw:
Yes, currently the TrackDrive is extremely similar to DiffDrive. The reason we add a TrackDrive system is for future extension, because there is a more accurate model for TrackDrive currently not supported by physics engine.

But once we resolve that, the better model could be implemented, and having a separate system early on could make it logically clearer? What do you feel?
content.html:
Yes, currently the TrackDrive is extremely similar to DiffDrive. The reason we add a TrackDrive system is for future extension, because there is a more accurate model for TrackDrive currently not supported by physics engine.

But once we resolve that, the better model could be implemented, and having a separate system early on could make it logically clearer? What do you feel?

content.raw:
This works well for me, but I'm not sure if there's much value in adding another system that is basically the same as the diff drive for skid steer.

Couldn't we just add `steeringEfficiency` to the `DiffDrive` system and use that for a tracked vehicle demo?
content.html:
This works well for me, but I'm not sure if there's much value in adding another system that is basically the same as the diff drive for skid steer.

Couldn't we just add steeringEfficiency to the DiffDrive system and use that for a tracked vehicle demo?
